item.name: Fractal Key
item.text:
This spiral bone key allows the user to traverse the planes. As an action, a creature in a Thin Place can create a gate to the Ethereal Plane for 1 minute, after which the key crumbles to dust
Creating the Fractal Key requires a Rare forge and the following components: • [Animus] from a Fractal Lepidoptera. • [Bones] of any Rare creature.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 305 (Third Party)

item.name: Monster Harvesting Tools
item.text:
The toolkit provides everything characters need to extract animus and preserve any creature parts. This kit contains skinning knives, a cleaver, syringes, a hammer, scissors, scalpels, a bone saw, hooks, as well as vials, watertight containers, binding reagents, and wrappings.
Harvesting Components:
Characters may harvest and preserve Components from the corpse of a slain creature using monster harvesting tools. Harvesting monster components or extracting its animus must begin within ten minutes of its death. After this time, the magical energy within fades and the animus passes to the ether, and any remaining Components are no longer usable for creating magic items. No ability checks are required to successfully harvest monsters or extract an animus. As long as a character has the time and tools, they always successfully collect one monster Component from a creature's corpse. The toolkit provides everything a character needs to extract and preserve parts from any creature.
Monster Components:
When the characters decide to harvest a monster's corpse, the Game Master determines which Components can be harvested from a monster, if any. In this book, each monster entry lists the Components available from that creature.
Component Rarity:
The rarity of all parts are determined by the CR of the monster as presented by the table earlier in this chapter. Most item recipes call for Components with the same rarity as the item itself. However, some recipes may call for a component from a specific named monster, such as a Frost Giant, an Ancient Red Dragon, or a Banshee. In such cases, if no part of the presented rarity is available for a monster of that type, the DM should allow a component of a lower rarity to be used. For example, the ghost site bow is a Very Rare item that requires the bones of a Dryad and the hair of a Banshee. In this case, these components require you to find any Dryad or Banshee and do not require the parts to be Very Rare.
Component Categories:
Each Component belongs to one of the following categories:
• Animus. This special Component is described below. • Bones. This includes the skull, spine, or the stem of a plant monster. • Dust. Detritus left behind by magical creatures or undead. • Fluid. Usually monster blood, and also ectoplasm, sap, or mucus. • Hair. Any fur or feathers. • Hide. Includes the monster's skin, scales, carapace, bark, or plates. • Natural Weapons. Almost any natural weapon from the monster's game statistics, such as teeth, claws, horns, tentacles, etc. • Organs. A broad category including both internal body parts and sensory organs, such as the heart, brain, glands, eyes, or guts.
Magical Animus:
In the world of Drakkenheim, magic items are created by imbuing a physical object with a metaphysical animus. This vital energy must be properly extracted from a magical creature. A creature's animus is formed from the latent magical energy held within its body, but it is distinct from a creature's soul. Aberrations, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Plants, Oozes, and Undead all possess a magical animus. Beasts and Humanoids typically do not possess an animus. When a creature is slain, its animus lingers momentarily before fading into the ether. However, a creature's animus can be collected and contained within a vessel of some kind, which is then used to make a magical item. It is impossible to extract the animus of a creature without killing it. Creating magic items requires the animus of one or more suitably powerful creatures. However, some magic items may call for a specific type of animus, such as the animus of a fey creature or dragon. In rare cases, a magic item may require the animus of a much more specific monster. Animus Vessels. An animus must be collected and stored in a specially prepared magical vessel. Traditionally, these vessels were minor magic items in their own right: often rune-etched gemstones infused with magic and created in a laborious process. However, the world of Drakkenheim was transformed by the arrival of delerium: the eldritch crystals function as suitable vessels in their raw state. A delerium crystal filled with magical animus glows with a brilliant octarine light, similar to how the crystals resonate with energy when exposed to magic. Creating Animus Vessels. An animus vessel can be created in 1 hour by combining any three other components of the same rarity. The resulting vessel can then be used as a vessel for an animus of the corresponding rarity. For example, an animus made from three Rare components can hold a Rare animus.
Animus Vessel Crystal Sizes Animus Rarity | Required Delerium Crystal Size Common | Chip Uncommon | Fragment Rare | Shard Very Rare | Crystal Legendary | Geode
Harvest and Extraction Time.
Once started, collecting Components or animus takes ten minutes of work. During this time, the character must remain within 5 feet of the corpse. If the process is interrupted, harvesting must resume within ten minutes, or the Components are lost. A player character may only harvest Components from one creature at a time, regardless of its size. Several characters can work together to harvest multiple parts from the same corpse. No matter how many characters harvest a single corpse, they must all spend ten minutes harvesting.
Collector's Choice
Each character may harvest one component from a creature's corpse per encounter. Characters can work together to harvest several different parts from one monster, or they may split up and harvest parts from several creatures at once. A monster's body usually provides only one of each available part, so two characters harvesting parts from the same corpse must choose to collect different parts, unless the Game Master determines that the creature's unique physiology allows the collection of multiples of the same part. For example, a Game Master might allow both horns from a Minotaur to be harvested, but it would take the work of two characters to collect both. Other parts may be more abstract in quantity: it's enough to know that the characters collected a bag of dragon fangs or a vial of troll blood without worrying about a specific measurement. When the player characters decide to butcher a carcass for Components, the Game Master lists all the possible Components available from the body. Each character may then choose one Component to collect. All other Components are lost and unusable, either because they were damaged in battle, ruined in the harvesting process, or deemed of unsuitable quality for magic item crafting.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 378 (Third Party)

item.name: Amulet of Incineration
item.text:
Crafted from a gem made from the elemental dust of an entropic flame set within a bone talisman, and glazed in the blood of an aberration, this amulet shimmers with an internal, ever-burning fire. Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals Fire damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt Fire damage by the spell to gain the Burning (3d6 Fire) condition.
Crafting. Creating an Amulet of Incineration requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from an Elemental • [Bones] Spine from a Monstrosity • [Dust] Elemental Dust from an Entropic Flame • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Amulet of Primal Wisdom
item.text:
Crafted from the dried leaves of magical plants and imbued with their dust, this amulet is decorated with a singular dried flower and then encased in sap. The pendant glows softly with the light of springtime and smells of floral fields in bloom. Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this magic amulet. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is 19 or higher without it.
Crafting. Creating an Amulet of Primal Wisdom requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Plant Animus • [Dust] Plant Dust • [Fluid] Sap • [Hair] Leaves • [Organ] Flower
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Aqua Delerium
item.text:
This purple potion glows dimly with octarine light. It swirls and sparkles in its small, stoppered bottle. When you drink this potion, you regain expended spell slots. Roll 1d6. You choose spell slots to regain which have a combined level equal to or less than the result. None of the slots can be higher than level 5. For one hour after drinking Aqua Delerium, roll 1d20 each time you cast a spell of level 1 or higher. On a 1, you trigger a random Arcane Anomaly. If you consume more than one dose of aqua delerium before finishing a Long Rest, you take 1d12 Necrotic damage for each spell slot level regained from the second dose, and your Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until you finish a Long Rest. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. When a creature who cannot cast spells using spell slots drinks Aqua Delerium, it takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage and gains one level of Contamination.
Crafting. Creating Aqua Delerium requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organ] Any Glands
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Aqua Expurgo
item.text:
This bright orange fluid is stored in a syringe and charged with arcane magic. You can use a Utilize action to administer the shot directly to the heart of yourself or another willing creature. You are protected against Contamination for six hours after receiving a dose of Aqua Expurgo. During this time, whenever you fail a saving throw against an effect which would cause you to gain one or more Contamination levels, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this ability three times, after which the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire. If the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire in this manner, you immediately take 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage and become Incapacitated for 1 minute while you violently retch corrupt bile. Your Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until you finish a Long Rest. You die if this effect reduces your Hit Point maximum to 0. The Necrotic damage can't be reduced or prevented by any means.
Crafting. Creating Aqua Expurgo requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organ] Flower from a Plant (traditionally an Eldritch Lily)
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Bracers of Arc Lightning
item.text:
These bracers are crafted with fine leathers decorated with magical scales, washed in elemental fluids, elemental dust, and contaminated ichor. The animus used must be from a creature that deals Lightning damage, allowing the bracers to channel the element. While wearing these magic bracers you gain Resistance to Lightning damage and Immunity to the Shocked condition. These magic bracers have six charges, and regain all expended charges each day at dawn. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one charge from the bracers to deal an extra 3d6 Lightning damage to the target. A target which takes this damage has the Shocked condition until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating bracers of arc lightning requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from a creature that deals Lightning damage (such as a Blue Dragon) • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Hide] Skin • [Hide] Scales
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

item.name: Champion's Battleaxe
item.text:
Attack rolls made using this magic weapon can score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Crafting. Creating a Champion's Weapon requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any • [Bones] Bones • [Fluid] Sap • [Hide] Plates
Proficiency: martial, battleaxe
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Retribution
item.detail: double-bladed scimitar, rare (requires attunement by a paladin)
item.text:
The metal of this blade is forged in the dust of celestials, with a hilt wrapped in fiend skin leather. The eye of a dragon is placed upon the hilt and polished in monster blood. When you use this magic weapon to attack a creature and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack roll, you can cast Divine Smite as part of the same action used to make the attack without expending a spell slot.
Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Crafting. Creating a Blade of Retribution requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Celestial Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood • [Hide] Skin from a Fiend • [Organ] Eye from a Dragon
Proficiency: martial, double-bladed scimitar
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party), Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 21, Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron p. 74

item.name: Rapier of Retribution
item.detail: rapier, rare (requires attunement by a paladin)
item.text:
The metal of this blade is forged in the dust of celestials, with a hilt wrapped in fiend skin leather. The eye of a dragon is placed upon the hilt and polished in monster blood. item.name: Charged Gauntlets
item.detail: very rare (requires attunement by a monk)
item.text:
These light gauntlets are made from cloth woven from the hair of a fiend and reinforced with the scales of a dragon. The gauntlets are washed with an alchemical formula made from elemental fluid and undead dust. They are then powered with a rare animus collected from an aberration. Each time you hit with an Unarmed Strike while attuned to these magic gauntlets they gain one charge. The gauntlets can have up to 10 charges. Any unexpended charges disappear when you take a Long Rest or roll Initiative. While the gauntlets have at least one charge, your Unarmed Strikes deal Lightning damage instead of its normal damage type. While the gauntlets have 5 or more charges, your Unarmed Strikes deal an additional 2d6 Lightning damage and push the target 10 feet away from you on a hit. You can expend 2 charges from the gauntlets to cast the Shield spell. You can expend 10 charges from the gauntlets to cast Destructive Wave or Wall of Force, using your monk's focus saving throw DC.
Crafting. Creating Charged Gauntlets requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Aberrant Animus • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hair] Hair from a Fiend • [Hide] Scales from a Blue or Bronze Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

item.name: Charm of Swarms
item.text:
This charm resembles a large gnat. It is made of the spores of dead mushrooms; the mandibles of an insectoid creature are placed upon it. The charm is coated in an acidic bile and held together by dried mucus. It smells of bugs and rot. When an enemy within 5 feet of you scores a Critical Hit on an attack made against you, you can cause the enemy to become Burning (2d6 Necrotic). While the target is Burning in this way, you have Advantage on attacks against the target.

When you cast a spell of level 1 or higher that restores Hit Points to a creature, that creature gains Valor (1d4) until the end of its next turn.

item.text:

item.name: Crimson Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar
item.text:
A blood-red ichor drips down this sword's darkened steel blade. The sword is coated in sanguine witch blood. The dust of dead vampires is forged into the steel of the blade, giving it its blackened sheen. The edge is then empowered by the heart of a dragon. Its gold hilt wrapped in crimson leathers and a blood- red ruby plucked from the corpse of a Sanguine Witch. The fangs of vampires decorate the pommel. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic sword. Any creature you hit with this weapon that isn't a Construct or Undead takes an extra 3d6 Necrotic damage, and you regain Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. Curse. While attuned to this blade, you can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of its occupants.
Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Crafting. Creating a Crimson Blade requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Undead Animus from a Sanguine Witch • [Dust] Undead Dust from any Vampire • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Undead • [Natural Weapons] Teeth from any Vampire • [Organ] Heart from a Dragon
Proficiency: martial, double-bladed scimitar

item.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar Between Worlds
item.text:
This otherworldly blade is made from starmetal steel; a potent alloy produced by combining iron with carbon extracted from the bones of powerful aberrant creatures. During the forging process, the blade is quenched in the spinal fluids of a Far Dweller to draw out extraplanar forces. The resulting metal has an octarine sheen that reflects possible worlds and other realities. The grip and crossguard are decorated with the barbs and leather of a Warp Marauder, and the pommel is set with a delerium crystal containing the eldritch essence of a Far Dweller that powers the weapon's magic. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon. Once per turn when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points using this weapon, immediately after the attack you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 120 feet you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another creature while wielding this weapon, you can make one weapon attack against that creature with this weapon as part of the same action or Bonus Action made to teleport. While holding the blade, you can use a Magic action to cast Dimension Door. Once you do, you must finish a Short or Long Rest before you can use this feature again. Curse. You have Disadvantage on saving throws against any spell or other effect which would forcibly teleport you or send you to another plane of existence.
Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Crafting. Creating a Sword Between Worlds requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Aberration Animus • [Bones] Skull, Spine, or Ribs from an Aberration. • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor from a Far Dweller • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration • [Natural Weapon] Tentacles from a Warp Marauder
Proficiency: martial, double-bladed scimitar

item.name: Greatsword Between Worlds
item.text:
This otherworldly blade is made from starmetal steel; a potent alloy produced by combining iron with carbon extracted from the bones of powerful aberrant creatures. During the forging process, the blade is quenched in the spinal fluids of a Far Dweller to draw out extraplanar forces. The resulting metal has an octarine sheen that reflects possible worlds and other realities. The grip and crossguard are decorated with the barbs and leather of a Warp Marauder, and the pommel is set with a delerium crystal containing the eldritch essence of a Far Dweller that powers the weapon's magic. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon. Once per turn when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points using this weapon, immediately after the attack you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 120 feet you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another creature while wielding this weapon, you can make one weapon attack against that creature with this weapon as part of the same action or Bonus Action made to teleport. While holding the blade, you can use a Magic action to cast Dimension Door. Once you do, you must finish a Short or Long Rest before you can use this feature again. Curse. You have Disadvantage on saving throws against any spell or other effect which would forcibly teleport you or send you to another plane of existence.
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Crafting. Creating a Sword Between Worlds requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Aberration Animus • [Bones] Skull, Spine, or Ribs from an Aberration. • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor from a Far Dweller • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration • [Natural Weapon] Tentacles from a Warp Marauder
Proficiency: martial, greatsword
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Electric Charge Ring
item.text:
This ring, composed of living lightning, is forged from elemental dust compressed into a gem around the lens eye of a construct, washed in the acidic glands of a monster before being set into an animus of an elemental. When you cast a spell using a spell slot that deals Lightning damage, choose one target that failed its first saving throw against that spell. That creature is Shocked until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating an Electric Charge Ring requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from an Elemental • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Organ] Eye from a Construct • [Organ] Glands
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Everhot Stew Pot
item.text:
This cauldron is made using the plated iron from a construct infused with the ash of an elemental. The animus used must be from a dragon which adds both control and potency to the latent elemental magics. The spoon used to stir the cauldron is carved from the bone of a magical creature. This cauldron can heat to boiling temperatures without requiring fire simply by being filled and stirred, and the stews and soups it produces are always delicious and hearty. During a Long Rest, you can cook enough stew to feed up to three creatures. All creatures who eat a stew from this pot gain 10 Temporary Hit Points. While a creature has these Temporary Hit Points, they gain Valor (1d4).
Crafting. Creating an Everhot Stew Pot requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Animus from a Dragon • [Bone] Ribs from a Monstrosity • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Hide] Plates
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Familiar Figurine
item.text:
Once per day as a Magic action, you can use this finely-carved figurine to cast Find Familiar.
Crafting. Creating a Familiar Figurine requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any • [Bones] Bones from a Giant • [Dust] Dust from an Elemental or Fey
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Frozen Ring Mail
item.text:
This armor channels cold energy through carefully manufactured veins of elemental fluid that run along the inside of its frame. Elemental dust is mixed with the gold in its forming, and contaminated ichor is used as a catalyst to magnify the magical effects. The animus gem placed centrally upon it must be infused with the energy of a frost giant. While attuned to this armor you have Resistance to Cold damage and are Immune to the Frozen condition. This magical armor has six charges, and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your Reaction and expend 1 charge from the armor to freeze your attacker in pace. The creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be Frozen (DC 15).
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Crafting. Creating Frozen Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from a Frost Giant • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 145

item.name: Ghost Sight Bow
item.text:
This bow is hand-carved carefully from the bones of a dryad and stained in the undead blood of vampires. Strung with the hair of a banshee with a powerful wraith animus is placed with-in the handle. Once the bow's crafting is complete, it fades from its physical form into a semi-corporeal form. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longbow. The bow produces its own spectral ammunition which deals Force damage instead of Piercing damage. The ammunition disappears when it hits or misses a target. While attuned to this weapon, you can use a Bonus Action to see into the Ethereal Plane and see all invisible creatures and objects until the end of your turn. Additionally, you can see through all walls and solid objects within 60 feet of you until the end of your turn. During this time, ammunition fired from this bow passes through solid objects, and you can target enemies within 60 feet of you with your ranged attacks, even if they are behind total cover. You can use this Bonus Action only if you haven't moved during your turn. After you use the Bonus Action, your Speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.
Crafting. Creating a Ghost Sight Bow requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare components: • [Animus] Undead Animus from a Wraith • [Bones] Skull from a Dryad • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Ectoplasm • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Undead • [Hair] Hair from a Banshee
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Half Plate Armor
item.text:
Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 145

item.name: Plate Armor
item.text:
Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 145

item.name: Spiked Armor
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Splint Armor
item.text:
This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 145

item.name: Hammer of Chaos, Maul
item.text:
A hammer of chaos is crafted by melting down the magical plates of otherworldly constructs, infused with both the fluid and dust of elementals. The weapon is then soaked in the grey matter of an aberrant brain. This steel hammer is fitted into a shaft made from fiend skin leather and the ribs of a dragon. You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon. This hammer has the Thrown property with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. The hammer deals 2d8 extra damage of the chosen type. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, if you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the hammer ricochets to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Make an attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll if the attack hits. After making this attack, the hammer flies back to your hand.
Crafting. Creating the Hammer of Chaos requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Spine from a Dragon • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Plates from a Construct • [Hide] Skin from a Fiend • [Organ] Brain from an Aberration

item.name: Giant Femur Club
item.text:
This club is made from the cleaned and polished femur of a giant, crafted finely into a usable two-handed club. Its tapered hilt is wrapped in stained leather. Fastened to the top of the club is a large troll skull with several monstrous teeth embedded into it like a bone morningstar, giving the weapon a grim appearance. The club is imbued with elemental power from the animus used to power the weapon, which causes it to crackle with elemental power. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greatclub, and you have Advantage on attack rolls made against Giants. While attuned to this club you deal an additional 2d6 damage of the type associated with the elemental dust infused into it.
Crafting. Creating a Giant Femur Club requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Giant Animus from a Troll • [Bone] Skull from a Troll. • [Bone] Bone from a Giant • [Dust] Elemental Dust from a Troll • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Teeth from a Giant, Beast, or Monstrosity The dust Component determines the additional damage the club deals. For example, dust from a Storm Troll deals Lightning damage. Eldritch Trolls cause the club to deal Necrotic damage.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Gloves of Ratling Agility
item.text:
Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these ratling hide gloves. They have no effect on you if your Dexterity is 19 or higher without them.
Crafting. Creating Gloves of Ratling Agility requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Fur from any Ratling • [Hide] Skin from any Ratling • [Organ] Guts from any Monstrosity
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Greater Rejuvenation Potion
item.text:
When you consume this potion, you immediately gain the benefits of a Long Rest. Once you consume a Greater Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish 3d6 Long Rests.
Crafting. Creating a Greater Rejuvenation Potion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components. • [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Any Giant • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Any Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Monster Blood from any Dragon • [Hair] Any Celestial • [Organ] Brain from an Aberration • [Organ] Heart from a Fiend
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Hag-Stitched Troll Hide Armor
item.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing this magic armor. This magic armor has 50 charges. It regains all expended charges each day at dawn. While wearing this armor and attuned to it, at the start of your turn you can expend between 1 and 10 charges from the armor (no action required). You regain 1 Hit Point for each charge expended in this way. If you take Acid or Fire damage while wearing this armor, it loses 1 charge for each point of Acid or Fire damage taken.
Crafting. Creating Hag-Stitched Troll Leather Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from a Giant • [Bones] Skulls of any two Trolls • [Fluid] Monster Blood from any Troll • [Fur] Stitches • [Hide] Skin of any Troll

item.name: Hazewind Cape
item.text:
This crimson and gold hooded cape is fitted with the feathers of fallen Harpies and dyed in their blood, this grants the wearer some resistance to the songs of Harpies. The cape is then infused with the dust of a fey creature which grants it a powerful anti-charm effect powered by an animus. While wearing this cape, you have Advantage on saving throws against the Charmed and Frightened conditions.
Crafting. Creating a Hazewind Cape requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Animus from a Harpy • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Harpy • [Hair] Feathers from a Harpy • [Hide] Skin
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Heart String Harp
item.detail: instrument, spellcasting focus, rare (requires attunement by a bard)
item.text:
When played, this instrument reverberates with draconic whispers and enchantment that drift subtly within the notes that are struck, giving the music a sense of foreboding and palpable charm. Crafted from finely polished ivory and imbued with the animus of a fey creature, the true magic of this harp comes from the finely crafted strings made from combining the sinew of a dragon's heart chords and the hair of a fey, willingly given out of kindness. You can use this magical harp as a Spellcasting Focus for your Bard spells. While attuned to this item, you gain a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC. When you cast an Enchantment spell of level 1 to level 5 that targets only one creature using this harp as the Spellcasting Focus, you can target a second creature within the spell's range.
Crafting. Creating a Heart String Harp requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Fey Animus • [Hair] Hair from a Fey* • [Natural Weapon] Horns or Teeth of any Fey, Monstrosity, or Dragon • [Organ] Heart from a Dragon *At the Game Master's option, rather than being harvested from a slain fey, this hair must be willingly gifted by a fey creature.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

item.detail: clothes, rare (requires attunement by a barbarian)
item.text:

The plates are then soaked in elemental fluid before having an animus gem installed that contains the energy of a Fire Giant. While your Rage is active, you gain Resistance to Fire damage. item.name: Inexhaustible Breastplate
item.detail: breastplate, very rare (requires attunement by a fighter)
item.text:
This armor is made from fey leathers and magical plates, infused with the chemical solutions found in some constructs and empowered with the heart of a gorgon. While attuned to this armor, you gain an additional use of your Second Wind class feature. In addition, when you use your Second Wind, you regain an additional 3d6 Hit Points and can remove one of the following conditions from yourself: Blinded, Charmed, Dazed, Deafened, Frightened, Immobilized, Poisoned, Slowed, or Staggered.
Crafting. Creating Inexhaustible Armor requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Chemical solution from a Construct • [Hide] Skin from a Fey • [Hide] Plates • [Organ] Heart from a Gorgon

item.name: Injector's Hand Crossbow
item.text:
This crossbow is covered in metal plating, decorative and refined pointed metal tips along an oak wood body, and foregrip. The barrel and limb are reinforced with the steel plates from a construct, with a stained leather grip made from a monster's hide. Its hair strung bowstring and leather fasteners hold a series of syringes in place. The crossbow's stock has a series of various tubes extruding from it that connect to an alchemical chamber on the side of the weapon. A mechanical wheel feeds the darts into place upon filling them, auto-loading the crossbow for easy firing. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic crossbow. This crossbow ignores the Loading property, and you don't need a free hand to load a piece of ammunition into it. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this crossbow, you can apply one of the following poisons. Virulent. The target takes an extra 2d6 Poison damage. Weakening. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is Weakened until the start of your next turn. Immobilizing. The target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is Immobilized until the start of your next turn.
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons").
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Loading: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Crafting. Creating an Injector Crossbow requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Chemical Solution • [Hair] Hair • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin • [Natural Weapons] Needles from an Injector
Proficiency: martial, hand crossbow
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

A mechanical wheel feeds the darts into place upon filling them, auto-loading the crossbow for easy firing. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic crossbow. This crossbow ignores the Loading property, and you don't need a free hand to load a piece of ammunition into it. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this crossbow, you can apply one of the following poisons. Virulent. The target takes an extra 2d6 Poison damage. Weakening. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is Weakened until the start of your next turn. Immobilizing. The target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is Immobilized until the start of your next turn.
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons").
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Loading: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

Proficiency: simple, light crossbow

item.name: Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma
item.text:
Structured from the fur and skin of a monstrosity and the horns of a fiend, and coated in the dust of fey creatures, this mantle is imbued with charming energies. Your Charisma score is 19 while you wear this magic cape. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is 19 or higher without it.
Crafting. Creating a Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Fur from a Monstrosity • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Horns from a Fiend • [Dust] Fey Dust
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.name: Manual of Occult Anatomy +1
item.text:
Filled with diagrams showing humans with alien features, this book of strange medical lore is written in monster-blood ink infused with draconic dust and then etched onto parchment pages made from aberration skin. The manuscript is bound in a scale-clad cover. You can use this manual as a Spellcasting Focus for your Apothecary or Warlock spells. When you use the manual as a Spellcasting Focus, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs of your Apothecary or Warlock spells. In addition, the book contains the knowledge of an Apothecary Esoteric Theory or Warlock Eldritch Invocation up to 6th level and chosen when the item is created, which you gain while you are attuned to it. This determines which class is required to attune to the item.
Crafting. Creating a Manual of Occult Anatomy requires a Workshop and Components of equal rarity to the item created. The Components required are: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Any Dragon Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Monstrosity • [Hide] Scales • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.name: Mask of Monstrous Forms
item.text:
This magic mask is made from the skull of a particular monstrosity (with a Challenge Rating of 6 or lower). The skull is carved into a mask, engraved with aberrant dust, and then boiled in a vat of mimic mucus, the flesh of a doppelganger, and acidic bile. Finally, a vessel containing the animus of any creature with the Shapechanger trait is placed upon the forehead of the mask, channeling its shapechanging magic. While attuned to the mask, you can expend two uses of your Wild Shape feature to transform into the monstrosity associated with the mask, instead of a Beast.
Crafting. Creating a Mask of Monstrous Forms requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Animus from a creature that has the Shapechanger trait • [Bones] Skull of a Monstrosity* • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Acidic Bile • [Fluid] Mucus from a Mimic • [Organ] Flesh from a Doppelganger * The Monstrosity used for this mask determines the form of the shapechange.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.name: Monster Hunter's Battleaxe +1
item.detail: battleaxe, rare (requires attunement by a ranger)
item.text:
These weapons are carved from bark, with a core of magical sap, and decorated with leaves from magical plants. Their hilts and shafts are bound in hair from a fey creature. This magic weapon channels the natural magic found in the elements of nature. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a Spellcasting Focus for your Ranger spells. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a Ranger spell slot to cast Hunter's Mark on the target as part of the same action used to make the attack. When you cast Hunter's Mark in this way it does not require Concentration. Additionally, the spell lasts for one minute or until the target dies or you cast Hunter's Mark again using either the weapon or otherwise.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Crafting. Creating a Monster Hunter's Weapon requires a Workshop and the following Components of rarity equal to the item's rarity: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Sap • [Hair] Hair from a Fey • [Hair] Leaves • [Hide] Bark
Proficiency: martial, battleaxe
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 390 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.detail: dart, legendary (requires attunement by a ranger)
item.text:
These weapons are carved from bark, with a core of magical sap, and decorated with leaves from magical plants. Their hilts and shafts are bound in hair from a fey creature. This magic weapon channels the natural magic found in the elements of nature. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a Spellcasting Focus for your Ranger spells. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a Ranger spell slot to cast Hunter's Mark on the target as part of the same action used to make the attack. When you cast Hunter's Mark in this way it does not require Concentration. Additionally, the spell lasts for one minute or until the target dies or you cast Hunter's Mark again using either the weapon or otherwise.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Thrown: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the Finesse property.
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Crafting. Creating a Monster Hunter's Weapon requires a Workshop and the following Components of rarity equal to the item's rarity: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Sap • [Hair] Hair from a Fey • [Hair] Leaves • [Hide] Bark
Proficiency: simple, dart
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 390 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Necromancer's Leather Armor
item.detail: leather armor, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)
item.text:
This suit of armor is constructed from the bones of the dead and outfitted over black woven fabric. The armor has two skulls as pauldrons upon the shoulders, a reinforced spine, and a rib cage that covers the front, and the entire structure is ornately decorated with the fangs of fallen beasts. The bones are magically imbued with otherworldly energy, powered by a powerful undead animus. While attuned to this armor, you are proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with light armor. While you are within 30 feet of an Undead creature under your control, you gain Resistance to all damage except Radiant. However, each time you take damage, choose an Undead creature under your control within 30 feet of you. That creature takes the same amount of damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

item.text:
This sickly-looking potion contains a writhing mass of tentacles that animate and uncomfortably crawl down the imbiber's throat when consumed. When you consume this potion, you gain the effects of one randomly determined Mutation until you start a Short or Long Rest. When you hit with an attack as part of an Attack action using this magic dagger and apply your Sneak Attack to the damage roll, you can make an additional attack using this dagger as part of the same action. If that attack hits and meets the criteria for your Sneak Attack, you can apply half your Sneak Attack dice (rounded down) to the attack's damage.
Crafting. Creating a Rat Tooth Dagger requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Venom • [Hide] Bark • [Natural Weapons] Claws from a Ratling
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Reflector Shield
item.text:
This magic shield is formed from the shell of an Anomollusk combined with leather from an aberration as its handle. It's fused together and coated in contaminated ichor and inset with a rare animus. Once complete, the shell gives off an otherworldly hue that shimmers in kaleidoscopic patterns. The shield can reflect attacks and magic. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, or Thunder damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to cause the creature to take the same damage (you still take the damage).
Crafting. Creating a Reflector Shield requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Hide] Shell from an Anomollusk • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 144

item.name: Rejuvenation Potion
item.text:
When you drink this bright purple potion, you immediately gain the benefits of a short rest. After you consume a Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish a 1d4 Long Rests.
Crafting. Creating a Rejuvenation Potion requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Any Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Dragon • [Organ] Heart from a Fiend
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party)

item.name: Retracer Boots
item.text:
These boots are crafted from the flesh and scales of a dragon and decorated with Harpy feathers and the webbed membranes of flying creatures. The soles are injected with goopy ooze, allowing their wearer to jump back in time and space. You can use a Bonus Action on your turn to click the heels of these boots together. When you do, you teleport to the space you occupied at the start of your turn so long as it is currently unoccupied.
Crafting. Creating Retracer Boots requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Goopy Ooze • [Hide] Scales from a Dragon • [Hide] Webbed Membrane • [Hair] Feathers from a Harpy • [Organ] Flesh from a Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Scroll of Spell Power
item.text:
When you roll damage for a spell of level 1 or higher, you can expend this scroll to re-roll a number of the damage dice up to the level of the spell cast. You must use the new rolls.
Crafting. Creating a Scroll of Spell Power requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Fey, Dragon, or Giant • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Scythed Arm Blades
item.text:
These steel arm blades are razor sharp, 4-foot-long scythes that are fastened to two locking bracers made of spinal bones. The fasteners are made from fine leather with steel buckles. Delerium crystals are embedded in the armbands, infusing the blades with energy. These magic shortswords function as a pair and must be wielded together for their magic properties to function. Attuning to the shortswords counts as being attuned to one magic item. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic shortswords. While attuned to these weapons, you can activate the Nick mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with these weapons.
Crafting. Creating Scythed Arm Blades requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Spine • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin from any Beast or Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Two Blades from a Reautomata
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 215 (2024)

item.name: Swashbuckler's Boots
item.text:
While wearing these supple leather boots, Opportunity Attacks against you have Disadvantage.
Crafting. Creating Swashbuckler's Boots requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Any
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Talon Gloves
item.text:
These leather gloves are outfitted with the talons of fallen beasts and stitched together with the arcane stitching of apothecary creations. The gloves are then empowered by elemental magic, reinforced with bone, and powered by an animus. While wearing these gloves, you gain Climb Speed equal to your Speed, and your Unarmed Strikes deal an additional 1d6 Piercing damage on a hit.
Crafting. Creating Talon Gloves requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hair] Stitches • [Hide] Skin • [Natural Weapons] Claws
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 393 (Third Party)

item.name: Tentacle Whip
item.text:
This whip is made from the tentacles and guts of aberrant creatures, stitched to the webbed membranes of winged beasts and fused to the bark of a plant creature. Once the animus is placed, the tentacles begin to writhe and wriggle and the whip can latch and drag creatures along the ground with uncanny strength. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic whip, which has a reach of 20 feet. Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack using this weapon, you can pull it 10 feet towards you.
Crafting. Creating a Tentacle Whip requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Stitches • [Hide] Bark • [Hide] Webbed Membrane • [Natural Weapons] Tentacles from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 393 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149

item.name: Time Dilation Medallion
item.text:
The inner workings of this clockwork device are formed from gears forged from magical constructs gathered around a focusing lens, held together carefully by the needles of magical creatures. The animus used harnesses the energy of The Algorithm, a being of order and consequence, whose control over time and space ripples from the strange clockworks of the medallion. This medallion has 3 charges. It crumbles to dust when you expend the final charge. You can expend 1 charge from the medallion to take an extra action on your turn. Each time you do, you can roll 1d6. On a 1, at the end of your turn, you become unstuck in time and space as the medallion casts the Maze spell on you. On a 6, the medallion regains 1d3 charges.
Crafting. Creating the Time Dilation medallion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components: • [Animus] Animus from The Algorithm* • [Hide] Plates from a Construct • [Natural Weapon] Any Needles • [Organ] Eye from a Construct * At the Game Master's discretion, the animus could be any other Legendary Construct instead.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Trollblood Potion
item.text:
This potion is a bubbling, sickly, green-brown viscous soup that has the consistency of mucus. What appears to be the rotting eye of a troll floats in the potion. It smells acrid and nauseating and tastes even worse than it looks. When you drink this potion, for the next minute, you regain Hit Points at the start of your turn. The effects of this potion end early if you take Fire or Acid damage.
Crafting. Creating a Trollblood Potion requires a Rare workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Fey Animus • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Troll • [Organ] Eyes from a Troll
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Vampire Blood Potion
item.text:
This potion is a crimson-red bubbling brew that tastes distinctly of copper. When you drink this potion, you gain the following benefits for the next minute: • You gain Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. • If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + half the damage taken, unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a success, you drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and the effects of this potion end. • The effects of this potion end early if you take Radiant damage or enter sunlight.
Crafting. Creating a Vampire Blood Potion requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components. • [Animus] Undead Animus • [Dust] Undead Dust from any Vampire • [Fluid] Ectoplasm • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Vampire
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Wand of Jinxes
item.detail: wand, rare (requires attunement by a warlock)
item.text:
This wand is carved from magical bark, with the hair of an undead creature in its core and finished in goopy ooze. Once per turn when you deal damage with a Warlock cantrip to a creature, you can make that creature Jinxed (1d4) until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating a Wand of Jinxes requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Goopy Ooze • [Hair] Hair from an Undead • [Hide] Bark
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Wand of the Precocious Apprentice
item.text:
Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature using a cantrip while holding this wand, one target of that cantrip takes an extra 1d4 damage of type dealt by the spell.
Crafting. Creating a Wand of the Precocious Apprentice requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components: • [Animus] Any • [Bones] Bones from an Undead • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Ectoplasm
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 395 (Third Party)

item.name: Whirling Bonesaw
item.text:
This large greataxe is made from a blade taken off a Ripper and refitted into a housing made from the plates of constructs and reinforced with the rib bones of a monstrosity. The blade is equipped with a leather belt that connects to an elemental-fuelled motor powered by a Very Rare Animus. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Once on your turn when you hit a Bloodied creature using this weapon, you can make one additional attack with this weapon as part of the same action.
Crafting. Creating a Whirling Bonesaw requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components: • [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Ribs • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin from any Monstrosity • [Natural Weapon] Blade from a Ripper
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 395 (Third Party), Player's Handbook p. 149
